definition: large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: In order to avoid traffic congestion, evening time tickets will also be provided.
sentences.chinese: 此外，爲避免白天交通高峯，還設計了夜場票。

sentences.english: There's no chance of a ticket for Saturday's evening show.
sentences.chinese: 沒有可能買到星期六夜場的票了。

sentences.english: Prices are usually lower in the daytime than at night.
sentences.chinese: 白天場的電影價格往往比夜場的要低得多。

sentences.english: Are we going to the matinee or the evening performance?
sentences.chinese: 我們去看日場還是夜場？

sentences.english: And waiting also all day for the night session, that is nerve-wracking on top of it.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須爲了夜場等一整天，這更是讓人神經緊繃。

sentences.english: I had to get used to playing at night again.
sentences.chinese: 我必須再次習慣夜場比賽。

sentences.english: The princess attended the opening night of the opera .
sentences.chinese: 公主觀看了那歌劇首次演出的夜場。

sentences.english: This offer is applicable to the regular price of matinee and night shows.
sentences.chinese: 此優惠只適用於日場及夜場之正價戲票。

definition: for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
specific topic (addressed by a book, lecture, TV program etc)/article, report or program etc on a specific topic
to depart as quick as a flash/flash mob
Wan Chai district of Hong Kong
opera (or role) involving much singing and action/(fig.) highlight/main feature/major activity
live (e.g. broadcast or recording)/what is actually happening/scene/the real situation
